title: Lesson 11 Quiz: More Joineries in Woodworking

questions.q: Which joint features interlocking rectangular “fingers” that fit together with glue?
The Corner-Bridle Joint is commonly used for:
options: Frames, furniture legs, and cabinet corners
questions.answer: Frames, furniture legs, and cabinet corners

questions.q: Which modern connector uses oval-shaped compressed wood pieces that expand when glued?
The Through-Dovetail Joint is well known for being:
options: Strong, decorative, and visible from both sides
questions.answer: Strong, decorative, and visible from both sides

questions.q: Pocket-Hole Screws are best described as:
options: Angled screws driven into predrilled holes for fast, strong fastening
Wooden pegs used with glue for frame assembly
Steel brackets attached with nails for reinforcement
Dovetail pins and tails interlocked for beauty and strength
questions.answer: Angled screws driven into predrilled holes for fast, strong fastening
